docTitle.titlePart:
Active Suspension Control of Ground Vehicle
Heave and Pitch Motions

front.div:
Abstract Ride quality depends on a combination of vertical displacement (heave) and angular displacement
(pitch). Road irregularities are the main factor affecting ride comfort. Suspension elements between the road
wheels and the vehicle body generate vertical forces which excite both heave and pitch motions. An active
controller design based on time-scale separation and an "input decoupling transformation" is given. It is shown
to give better performance that conventional passive suspension control.
